children.name: circle of friends
children.definition: /circle the people you know, especially a group of friends who all know each other and often meet socially: nhóm bạn
examples: He had a large circle of friends.
Since my children have started school, my circle has widened to include the mothers of other kids.

children.name: the boys
children.definition: /the girls  a group of male or female friends who often do things together: hội bạn trai, bạn gái
examples: Sally’s having a night out with the girls from the office.
It’s his poker night with the boys.
He used to like spending Friday nights with the boys.
He used to like spending Friday nights with the boys.
The girls at work gave it to me.
I'm going out with the girls tonight.
the lads[UK] [plural noun] [informal] a group of men who are very friendly with each other or who work together or play in a team together:
The lads played really well -- we were unlucky not to win the game.

children.name: the gang
children.definition: informal a small group of friends who often meet socially: tụi bạn
examples: I usually go out with the gang on Saturday nights.
She was in our gang at school.
I went out with the usual gang from college on Friday night.
one of the gangaccepted into the group of friends
She’s not really one of the gang, but I invited her to the party.

children.name: crowd
children.definition: /kraʊd/  informal a group of friends who often do things or go out together : nhóm bạn, tụi bạn
examples: He wasn’t with his usual crowd last night.
It may be necessary to change your child’s school if they get in with a bad crowd.

children.name: set
children.partOfSpeech: [a group of friends who meet socially, especially because they are all interested in the same sport or activity, especially an expensive one]
children.definition: the tennis/ golf club/ arty etc giới
examples: She likes to mingle with the arty set.

children.name: cronies
children.definition: a group of people who know each other, and will help each other, even if this means being slightly dishonest : bạn chí thân, bạn nối khố
examples: Weiss was careful not to upset his political cronies.
Her father is probably in the bar, drinking with his cronies.
The General and his cronies are now awaiting trial for drug-smuggling.

children.name: friend
children.definition: bạn
examples: Dad, this is my friend Steve.
She’s going to Palm Springs with some friends.
I got a letter from a friend from college.
friend of mine
I’m going out for a drink with a friend of mine tonight.
be a good friend to sb[to be sb’s friend and help them a lot when they have problems]
John was a really good friend to me when I had all those problems last year.

children.name: mate
children.definition: a friend - use this especially about boys or men: bạn (trai)
examples: He always goes to the pub with his mates on Friday night.
mate of mine
Terry’s an old mate of mine.

children.name: buddy
children.definition: informal a friend - use this especially about men or young people:
examples: He’s one of Mike’s buddies.
army/ high school/ war etc buddy
He’s out playing basketball with some of his high school buddies.

children.name: pal
children.definition: a friend. Pal is slightly more old-fashioned than mate or buddy: bạn
examples: Nicholas was a pal of William’s at school.
Thanks for helping us out, Frankie. You’re a real pal.

children.name: sb who does sth with sb else
partner
children.definition: a person or organization you are closely involved with in some way : cộng sự; đối tác
examples: He gave up his job as a police officer after his partner was killed.
The two companies are partners in a contract to build a new power station.
a business/ trading partner: đối tác kinh doanh
Manson and I were business partners, but not friends.
be partners

children.name: fellow
children.partOfSpeech: [sb who is travelling, working, studying etc with you]
children.definition: passenger/ worker/ student etc
examples: The accident happened when Roland was walking home with fellow student Karl Xavier.
Toni’s views on the Kyoto Treaty were echoed by her fellow workers.

children.name: companion
children.definition: a person you spend a lot of time with either because you are friends or because you are travelling together : bạn
examples: Mum and Dad didn’t seem to approve much of my new companions
He left the major part of his £60 million fortune to his close friend and companion, Jerry Edwards.
The dog has been herconstantcompanion these past ten years.
a drinking/ travelling etc companion: bạn nhậu/ đồng hành...
Ed is a great travelling companion - funny and sensible at the same time.

children.name: sidekick
children.definition: informal sb who spends a lot of time with another person, and is usually less important or powerful than them: đồng mưu, cộng tác
examples: Tom and his sidekick Larry sauntered into the bar, plainly looking for a fight.
Sherlock Holmes and his sidekick Dr Watson

children.name: friendship
children.definition: tình bạn
examples: Our marriage is based on friendship, love, and trust.
We didn’t see each other much during that time, but our friendship remained strong.
Did youformany close/lasting friendships while you were at college?
friendship with
I had no close friendships with other boys at school.
friendship between
Bernstein’s visit to Copland’s studio led to a friendship between the two composers.

children.name: companionship
children.definition: a friendly and comfortable relationship with sb that you enjoy spending time with: tình bạn, bầu bạn
examples: He was lonely and looking for companionship.
Older people often benefit from having a pet for companionship.

children.name: sb you know, but not very well
acquaintance
children.definition: sb that you know and sometimes see, but who is not one of your close friends: người quen
examples: She’s just an acquaintance - I sometimes see her at aerobics.
I don’t want to talk about religion with business acquaintances.
She’s just an acquaintance -- I see her sometimes at night school.
business/ childhood/ musical etc acquaintance
I first heard of the idea from a business acquaintance in Montpelier.
mutual acquaintance[one that you and someone else both know] quen lẫn nhau
Jane and I met through a mutual acquaintance at a party.

children.name: have met/met
children.definition: if you have met sb, you have seen and talked to them, although you do not know them very well: đã gặp qua, đã từng gặp
examples: ‘Do you know Chris?’ ‘Yes, we’ve met.’
We met once before at Jo’s house.

children.name: good friend
children.definition: good/ close friend sb that you know very well and like very much: bạn thân
examples: Helen is one of my closest friends.
Sam and I didn’t get along very well at first but now we’re really good friends.
They were close friends of my parents when we lived in Minneapolis.

children.name: best friend
children.definition: the one special friend who is more important to you than any other: bạn tri kỷ
examples: We lived next door to each other when we were kids, and we’ve been best friends ever since.
Caroline and her best friend both had babies within three weeks of each other.

children.name: old friend
children.definition: a good friend that you have known for a long time: bạn cũ
examples: Lotte’s one of my oldest friends.
I saw a few old friends at the reunion.

children.name: inseparable
children.definition: friends who are inseparable are together most of the time: không thể tách rời, không thể chia lìa được
examples: My brother and James have been inseparable since they were at primary school.
The three girls were inseparable friends.

children.name: go back a long way
children.definition: /go way back informal if two people go back a long way, they have known each other or been working together for a very long time: quen biết đã lâu
examples: Sam and I go way back. We sat next to each other in first grade.
I know your aunt - in fact we go back a long way.

children.name: have friends in high places
children.definition: quen biết nhiều người có vị thế
examples: He won’t lose his job -- he has plenty of friends in high places.

children.name: well-connected
children.definition: having friends who have a lot of influence: quan hệ tốt (với những người có thế lực)
examples: The couple were well-educated and well-connected members of an elite social class.
Richardson is very well-connected, both in the Democratic leadership and on political committees.

children.name: a friend of a particular type
girlfriend
children.definition: the female friend of a woman : bạn gáí
examples: Susan was going out to lunch with her girlfriends.
She’s out with one of her girlfriends.

children.name: pen pal
children.definition: /penfriend sb who you exchange letters with as a hobby, but usually have not met : bạn trên thư từ; quan hệ bạn bè qua thư từ
examples: I've got a pen pal in Australia.

children.name: roommate
children.definition: /flatmate  sb that you share an apartment with, who is not a member of your family and not your sexual partner: bạn cùng phòng, bạn trọ cùng
examples: This is Rosalind, my flatmate.
You can’t have a party without asking your flatmate first.
My roommate and I aren’t getting along very well - I think I’m going to have to move.

children.name: stranger
children.definition: someone you do not know : người lạ
examples: The room was full of strangers.
My mother always warned me not to talk to strangers.
be a stranger to sb
After assuming office, he was reluctant to use the existing speech writers because they were strangers to him.
perfect/complete stranger[use this to emphasize that you do not know sb at all]
The boy was a complete stranger to me.
I'd never met anyone at the party before-they werecompletestrangers.

children.name: sb who lives next to you
neighbor
children.definition: neighbour  sb who lives next to you or near you :
examples: One of the neighbors complained about the noise from the party.
FBI agents were interviewing all their friends and neighbors.
Ournext-door neighbours(= the people who live in the house next to us )say they’ll look after our cat for us while we’re away.
Some of the neighbours have complained about the noise from our party.
Have you met Pat, my next-door neighbour?

children.name: mutual friend
children.definition: a person who is the friend of two people who may or may not know each other : bạn chung
examples: Lynn and Philmet througha mutual friend.

children.name: friend of a friend U
children.definition: friend of a friend sb who is not really your friend, but is sb one of your friends knows: bạn của bạn mình
examples: I got the tickets through a friend of a friend who works in the theatre.
No I don’t know him personally, he’s a friend of a friend.
